body:
## WORKAROUND:

 The fix is to add structopt as a direct dependency in the `Cargo.toml`.


## Error

I hit this error when upgrading a CLI crate to the Rust 2018 edition:

```console
$ cargo build
   Compiling quicli-edition v0.1.0 (file:///Users/gib/tmp/quicli-edition)
error[E0463]: can't find crate for `structopt`
 --> src/main.rs:8:17
  |
8 | #[derive(Debug, StructOpt)]
  |                 ^^^^^^^^^ can't find crate

error: aborting due to previous error

For more information about this error, try `rustc --explain E0463`.
error: Could not compile `quicli-edition`.

To learn more, run the command again with --verbose.
```

I've tried to give a minimal reproduction here: [gibfahn/quicli-edition](https://github.com/gibfahn/quicli-edition)

Basically: 
- I followed the [quicli getting started guide](https://killercup.github.io/quicli/) to get set up. 
- Everything works in the 2015 edition (https://github.com/gibfahn/quicli-edition/commit/626f47c494f7595fe3d64dc8d4cb1b6be33819e6)
- When I upgrade (following the edition guide) I get the above error: (https://github.com/gibfahn/quicli-edition/commit/81977e7c934194e226d99bf9a881c0b3bded921f)
- The fix is to add structopt as a direct dependency in my `Cargo.toml`. This wasn't necessary with the 2015 edition (https://github.com/gibfahn/quicli-edition/commit/4ce7ba9d09b96f52dbbc0f1f214617a2fdbff82b).

Obviously this could be just a mistake on my part, or it could be a change `quicli` needs to make (cc/ @killercup ).
